I’d like to end with some beautiful nature landscapes, gifts, and animal encounters to let the essence of these spaces and experiences linger with you. I feel we can use a lot more of these kinds of broadcasts across the globe to help align each of us with the nature of our own vibrational frequencies.

Days continue to be filled with rich nature gifts and wildlife encounters even when not out backpacking – all made possible by a pause and deep presence.

I was tickled to find these Sweet Pea flowers on a hike and took some home to enjoy in a vase, as I knew that would warm Dave’s heart. When I surprised him with them and told him their name his heart melted.

I am also grateful to now have found two eagle feathers and that we just last evening had a black bear visitation.

Dave caught the photo above, as the bear made his way between our house and our neighbor’s house. You can see him at the center by their camper. Apparently dogs were barking in the forest and chasing him. The bear was just trying to escape peacefully.

Other recent wild friend connections have included a collective of frogs and large toads, a big garter snake, Canadian geese, and another bear (briefly seen across a lake on a day outing).

I spend a lot of quiet time with the frogs. I find them so complex and full of personality and wisdom.

Some are more timid and will jump or slip away into the water. Others have no fear at all and will let me softly approach, as they listen to me talk. The more I talk, the more the others reappear and soon everyone’s hanging out like a frog convention to listen to this odd creature who cares to hear what they have to say.

The large garter snake would not have been seen if I hadn’t been in complete presence, as she was very keen on not wanting to be seen by others. Yet, she allowed me into her space and I stayed with her for a good fifteen minutes. Anytime someone walked by, including a group of children, she would slither deeper in the bushes and hide.

Once she felt their vibrations leave, she’d then circle back around and peek out at me to make sure I was still there.

It was during this time I heard a group of kids with their Summer guide call out “bear” across the lake, giving me just a glimpse on the other side of the water where I was with Miss Sssssnake.

There are so many beautiful little encounters and experiences to be had no matter where we are.

It all just takes a desire to want to dance in the gift of each moment and look around at the bigger picture held within one tiny thread.

One of our favorite spots when not backpacking is hanging out under the giant elder Juniper you’ve seen me share about many times.

It’s a peaceful and beautiful spot where sometimes the Canadian geese will come visit us – this last time a family of mom and dad and seven adolescent geese in fact did come graze and lay with us.

The serenity and scene here is picturesque and surreal.

And you feel one with all of life, including the little ones that will come to play.

This last visit the chipmunk you see here, came and sat on my bare foot nestled into the cool grass while I closed my eyes to dream.

It’s a place to surrender and allow Great Great Grandmother Juniper watch over you and remove any worries – replacing them with wisdom she’s come to know about life on Earth. All around her stand her Juniper lineage who someday will take over the storytelling when her presence is called back to the stars.

She is currently in process of being registered as a “Champion Juniper” and is thought to be over 1500 years old. More information is upcoming to be shared with the public after this process.

For now, they’ve finally created a protective fence around her trunk to help her to live another 700 or more years.

We have so much available to us to learn from the elders and wisdom keepers that surround our daily lives in less outspoken ways. If only as much time was spent tuning in to them, as is spent tuning in to everything else.

The more I drop into and harness the elements I embody, the more experiences become seamless and deeply engaging.

May we all experience the natural vitality coursing through our veins and streaming through as spirit in flesh.

Over time I’ve become increasingly more conscious and attuned with the elements and now make it a daily practice to work in partnership with them and tap into the ability we all have to play in that field with empowerment.

Each of the elements teach me so much and it’s my relationship to them within that helps me to make sense of their reflection without, as well as supports my apprenticeship into magician hood.

As Water I learn to continually purify my thoughts and beliefs, not fear the depths, remain fluid, flow with rather than against, and use my feelings and intuition to sense into that alignment and understand the true undercurrents at work.

As Air I understand the softness of embodiment I can carry on a breeze to touch others, the strength and reach of my transformational force when I step into my power, the way presence can be humble and invisible while still experienced and shared, and how to communicate or pick up messages by constantly shifting perspective, and never remaining stagnant or stuck.

As Fire I know the constant renewal of each moment that is available, my ability to rebirth through unlimited creative life force, the power inherent in life cycles as a unified transmutational experience, the boldness of my will to manifest through action-backed desires, and yes I will always rise from the ashes as the perpetual artist of unlimited and multi-dimensional expression.

As Earth I am the ever-anchored container to hold all moving parts with nourishment and stability, able to manifest all thoughts and desires into solid form, maintain balance and grounding, am the eternal mother holding all of life in an unconditionally loving gaze, luxuriate in my sensuality of embodiment, celebrate my basal nature, and harness my feminine power to ever-be fertilely birthing anew.

As Spirit I know my lightness, clarity, the vast expanse within, the beauty of all other elements that fill that space, know the limitlessness available, the power of my vibrational frequency, understand the bigger picture, enjoy embodiment as a gift for experiential delights, and celebrate connection between all things.

We can tap into the vibrational frequency of the Big Five, just as we can any aspect of consciousness being expressed, and permanently put a stop to victimhood. It really isn’t a hard thing to do. It simply takes action to support the desire to do it, and that equates to presence combined with redirection of focus on a consistent basis.

Mental alchemy is an invitation – not a given – and as long as we don’t consciously choose to engage it, then everyone and everything else will simply do so for us. There is always cause and effect in play, but we get to choose which of those we’d like to experience more of with responsible integrity.

I don’t have to tell you that the nature realm is where I feel most at home on Earth, as my shares I think reflect that enough even if just through photos. We each have a different way to experience our joy – and this just happens to be mine, as well as happens to be my choice of both classroom and playground. The latter equating to being my joy reminder, as everything “nature” tickles my heart.

The way I live isn’t for everyone and nor did it happen by chance or without a lot of preparatory back story. I think it’s easy to forget that people have years of experiences behind them when we only see how they are experiencing things right now.

Work turns into practice, turns into play and fun – a way of being with increased ease and grace.

And summertime can definitely highlight what both lights you up, or shines a light upon what’s been tucked away out of sight.

Summer is vitality at its finest to me, but the same kind of creative life force is available to us all year round. We simply have to invite it into our lives from the unlimited well within our hearts.

We carry the light of the Great Central Sun within our very being. And even in the darker hours and hidden corners, that light will guide our way.

Pay attention to what sparks your joy and use that as a reminder that you can reframe each experience from a different perspective by engaging that feeling it ignites.

Maybe take a moment to feel into yourself and ask the parts within what lights them up.

What are your joy reminders?

You can use these as hinge points to shifting any experience in the moment, by calling up that reminder and instantly being taken to the feeling vibration it pours through, and illuminates within, you. This can help you to change the current story playing over and over in your experience, and anchor you in a new frequency that immediately pulls you out of the quicksand with a lifeline.

Try it. Make it a practice. Do it consistently. You’ll be amazed at the new empowerment you have at your fingertips in one easy sweep of a joy refocus.

It’s similar to a gratitude practice, yet it will transport you into the feeling and cellular memories of your joy triggers, right away, that can multiply with rapid grace as you tap into a real feeling and experience that becomes your now. There is no time distinction or separation between what you feel and think about, and what you are right here in the eternal now. Therefore, it really does help to have these joy reminders in your back pocket to call up when you notice yourself stuck.

It also helps if you make friends with and understand the power of the elements that reside within you and are you – the control board to outer experiences at your fingertips that can support your optimal alignment and strategic placement.

For me, this has become one of my key pieces to creating life alchemy, along with fine-tuning even the smallest of tweaks to my perception of bigger picture things that stretch expansion open wider.

Two weekends ago we had our first Tahoe Herbivores Meetup for this Summer, which was a fun gathering of nine of us for a hike, followed by lunch.

But what I loved most about this day was the wildlife reflections in what was quite an extraordinary display – perfectly mirroring collective key pieces calling from within to be seen, heard, and embraced.

These included a first-ever sighting for us, here, of river otters and a first sighting of baby osprey with mom.

We were crossing a bridge over the river – that alone has meaning – when my hawk eyes caught a brown mound slightly moving across the way. I knew immediately it was some kind of animal – thinking beaver at first – so I stopped and then told my friend walking just ahead of me that there was an animal over there. As I continued to watch I realized there were more than one – actually four – and they were all climbing over each other and very connected.

They then slid into the water and I said that they were either beavers or river otters, but once I saw them moving in the water I said they didn’t move like beavers…they were acting like otters. At this point, the rest of the group behind us had caught up and the group ahead had stopped and were looking at other things. I pointed them out and the whole group came in closer to watch and asked me what kind of animal I thought they were. I shared my two first initial thoughts, but added that they were moving like otters. At that point I caught glimpse of long whiskers on the larger one lit up by the sunlight and long thin tails slinking behind them as they moved in and out of the water and around each other. I was now certain of my intuition upon watching their behavior that they were in fact river otters and not beavers, despite our never seeing any here before.

This was a family of mom and three younger ones and they were just in pure play mode in and out of the water. And when out of the water they just climbed all over each other and were like one unit, without separation between them, just nuzzling and wrapping around one another. Love, joy, lightness, and playfulness emanated from this display that went on and on.

It was evident to me immediately that they were reflecting the power and value of the inner child and that the group was needing this reminder.

And in fact, otters do embody and message joy and play being important. Finding joy even through the challenges, finding that balance in all situations, and having limitless curiosity are spoken through their energy. If you watch them move in and out of the water and playing and merging with each other it’s so fluid and like one moving part together – helping to navigate things seamlessly and light heartedly as a team. They represent community and togetherness with peace and kindness at the forefront of interactions. There’s also shape-shifting qualities, resiliency, adaptability, divine feminine mysteries and understanding of the subconscious, psychic and emotional realms that come through as well. They represent both water and earth elements embodied, wholeness, harmony, new beginnings, purification, and spiritual awakening.

When I continued to research otter symbolism I found this to underscore my initial feeling.

Otter shows up when people have lost sight of their inner child. They help remind us to embrace new things without clinging to the past, just like children live moment-to-moment.

I found it interesting no one saw them as we passed, but my hawk eyes immediately did and of course like attracts like. I got the feeling I was meant to be a bridge (we were on a bridge afterall, too) for the river otters to share their message with the group, as I know this to be one of my roles in life as an interspecies ambassador.

When I felt into everyone around me who later sat in awe watching – it was evident why the clan showed up as they did to support inner child encouragement and to send a message to stop being so serious about life. It was fun that a clan appeared for a clan, with the perfect energy that was calling from their hearts to be embraced. Everything is always messaging us from the wisdom within.

We proceeded on after watching the river otter family for quite a while, and about a half mile further we came upon the sound of a young bird of prey calling out. We looked up and a large osprey was circling overhead and a young osprey was calling out from a big nest at the top of a dead tree.

Osprey to me is a master of depths and heights, as the only bird of prey that actually dives under the surface of water to capture their meals – speaks to balancing consciousness with unconsciousness and being that bridge that merges things together and brings things to awareness. Water, air, and earth elements are strongly their suit, but they do take bold actions which demonstrates fire, and are messengers between realms – so there’s spirit too.

I loved seeing the young one with momma, interacting as she circled and circled and baby called out. There was the feeling of nurturing and nourishing the inner child, as well as not being afraid to ask for what you want. While protectiveness from mom and caring for the well being of new life coming into the world to flourish was part of that wholeness of experience. We have the ability to be that nurturer to the parts within – the child within – and cultivate an empowered life experience that understands the wisdom and beauty of dancing in the gifts of light and shadow.

As we sat watching I looked down at the ground and found a smaller osprey feather – more of a breast or head feather likely from the youngster.

After we turned around to head back, we crossed the bridge again and stopped to watch as the river otter family STILL continued to play and love on each other. I took this video, while the group moved on and I stayed behind. You can see the otter family in the foreground with two Canadian geese preening themselves in the background.

Both sightings were powerful and purposeful, but also so beautiful in and of themselves.

I’ve continued to see my wild baby bunny friend (now named Ursa – because she’s my little “bear” guardian) here at the Forest Portal too, along with Hyzenthlay nearly every day.

The female energy is strongly showing up.

The rabbit sightings appear in the morning and evening and see us off before we leave on adventures, while also welcoming us back home too.

Even one of my dear friends just shared with me a new family of wild rabbits in her yard including momma and FIVE baby bunnies that are precious beyond preciousness. All of this just pointed to so much of what I’ve already been sharing in this post. And I loved that bunny portal activation going on across the states too. Weeeeeeee!

And speaking of adventures, we just got back on Thursday from another backpacking and camping three-day amazing journey. We felt guided to return to our same spot as last time because it’s so nourishing to us on every level.

After the initial hike up, it’s a purely relaxing, fun, disconnected but fully in tune with the ALL time.

Right before we headed to our lake destination, this giant, extraterrestrial looking insect welcomed us back. He was sitting on our car window as we got our backpacks on and I moved him to a tree stump where he sat before flying off into the forest.

And on my way out on our day home I found my first ptarmigan tail feather, which was a special gift that encouraged my fortitude hiking out with a heavy pack again.

This alpine bird embodies resiliency, strength, determination, courage, power, protection, and hope – all perfect messages while I forged my way up the first climb out to the highest summit point. They are also known as thunder birds, messengers of the gods, and connection to higher spiritual forces. Recently, when I find a significant feather, I can actually feel how it has been placed there precisely as a manifestation for communicating to me something timely – not just as a theme for a general time period, but specific to the exact thing I’m thinking about, opening up to, concluding, realizing, or doing.

So, yeah, those “firsts” in terms of finds and experiences have been ongoing recently and I also had the most incredible firsts in terms of crystal finds on this trip.

Yes, I did go on my quartz expeditions again – in fact I went twice in one day while Dave napped and read in the hammock at our campsite. He also did a twenty minute hike way up the mountain overlooking our lake home-away-from-home to explore what we thought might be the mother quartz we could see from our campsite.

He did confirm the white area was in fact all quartz. I may explore the area next time, but for now it was his journey and he laid on this big mother to receive activation himself, while taking this shot of the view of the lake, our camping area, and Lake Tahoe far in the left distance.

While he did that, I hiked out before and after lunch to the spot I’ve discovered about a mile out and spent two to two and a half hours each trip in full-on faery mode, being led by intuition and senses to amazing finds up the slopes of the mountain.

I was guided to wear my seven-pointed faery star necklace with moldavite on this trip and I used it to tune in, by holding it and having intention to be led. I would even state out loud, “Okay Fae, Elementals, and Cosmic friends, lead on. I’m listening!” And boy did they answer.

Each trip I’ve increasingly found more and more incredible pieces, but this trip was icing on the cake.

I usually find quartz rock with some clear crystal forming on them. This trip and last trip these increased with much more crystal formations on the rock and moved into tons of pure crystal chunks of all sizes and then…actual, full formed or forming crystals appeared.

Last time I started finding chunks that had keys, starbrary, information lines down the sides, and other interesting markings even though they weren’t fully formed crystals.

This time I found full-on shaped points, partial points, cluster points, earth-damaged (but self-healed) points without the tops or some sides gone or not fully formed yet, AND several tabby quartz, along with golden healers, smoky citrine, pinkish and blueish quartz, a few incredible pure smoky quartz – two of which are big and pure crystal and just WOW.

The photos share some looks at what I’m talking about, however don’t do them justice.

AND EVERY SINGLE ONE of the pieces I found had remarkable rainbows in them that were twinkling to say, “Here I am!” The rainbows were brilliant and large and didn’t even need shifting them various ways to bring them out.

I knew I was being led by the Fae energies, as it was extraordinary. I was astonished at what I was finding and didn’t even know these were possible here. But then, anything is, especially when you believe.

I had this feeling before our trip that something was awaiting me to receive and I held this idea around finding full crystals and then it happened on 7/17 – this day felt like full-on M-A-G-I-C-K.

I was careful about choosing what to bring back from the pieces the mountain spirits gifted, so as not to be too heavy of a pack to hike out with. I ended up with 38 pounds I hiked out the six and a half miles with instead of 45 pounds last time. And that was aided by my burying five larger pieces to await my return. And oh can I not wait to return because now I know what is possible and you better believe I’ll be off on more crystal adventures for sure to see what extraordinary things I can manifest next!

I actually pooped myself out over a period of four consecutive days, so the restful time after my magickal expeditions, on long camping later afternoons and nights, was perfect.

Note to self: Not the greatest idea to go on backpacking and crystal expedition trips immediately following two days of deep cleaning your entire house. LOL! I surely worked my butt off then, the day up to our camping site at over 9000 elevation, during my two expeditions of hiking, searching, and transporting to campsite, and our hike back down. But it’s also super exhilarating and amazing to see the endurance and strength one does have when met with mental alchemy to fuel the way. That, plus a lot of amped up crystal activations, protection, and recharging!

The evening we returned home we decided to go to our first free Music on the Beach event to slowly integrate back into mountain city vibes.

It was a peaceful evening with the usual mellow crowd, and a couple we know met up with us to watch the sunset and listen to smooth vibes.

I did actually find a dead baby mouse on the deck where the dead baby bunny was that one time, when we returned home. Her insides were gone, but the full fur body and tail remained. I held a little ceremony and buried her in the garden, feeling like a resurrection of inner child power was emerging within me. Rather than seeing this as an end, I immediately dropped into it definitely being a new beginning of magickal potentials.

While away, both my indoor and outdoor gardens flourished.

I took these photos yesterday on a cloudy, thunderstorm day, but as you can see everything beams happy still and of course is another addition to my own joy reminders.

The next wave of my giant lilies are now all starting to bloom in orange, yellow, and star lily white.

I’m amazed by how tall the garden plant babies are – the lilies tower over my head – and I’m loving the tropical and exotic feel to my indoor plants, including calla lilies in all shades of pinks, lilacs, and mauves.

Life is a beautiful expression of color our hearts splash, swish, and stroke across the canvas of creation.

We had some beautiful views to relish in with the Moon over my heart – our Star Lake campsite and high-vibed quartz mountain playground that is – with golden sunset casts across the water and trees and even a “Great Pyramid” looking peak, peaking out – which isn’t surprising to me. All my favorites packed into one tiny corner of this vast Earth realm.

This was just a few days before the full illumination of this second Capricorn Full Moon in a row and it felt perfect to be high up in alpine regions like a mountain goat where my horns can receive from the Cosmos, my hooves can navigate the root of being, and my senses can be guided by the elements – as within so without.

Today we have opportunity to harness the most productive qualities Capricorn teaches us, and that to me includes leading by your own inner compass and maturing into the responsible authority of your energetic field so that outside things are directed by your inward focus. You can master your reality and by example, lead the way for others to do the same.

Try not to let world stories direct your emotions and life, nor get caught up in illusions. Be discerning with your time and focus and see if you find yourself taking sides.

Any side is not unity. Unity is wholeness of perspective and the way out of sides is to create something more ALL-encompassing. You may think that is impossible or will take forever. That is only the truth as long as you believe it and as long as you relinquish your power to create it.

Wishing you a strengthening Full Moon and a happy 56th anniversary to my parents today as well! May love endure across this beautiful Earth and beyond.

Summer vibes continue in full swing and to me that looks like cherries, watermelon, sunflowers, lazy beach days, picnics, home-brewed iced tea and coffee, a garden in full bloom, camping,

outdoor live music, biking, hiking, kayaking, meadows of croaking frogs and buzzing pollinators, thriving forest life, evening star gazing, and expansive creative visualization.

And after saying all that, I still feel at a loss for words these days, which of course seems odd and humorous for someone so expressive.

Yet, I don’t feel my expression is lost in any way – it’s merely enhancing and deepening into even more of its natural essence.

That may also not seem to be the case, as when I DO share I have a decent amount to say.

But my shares are infrequent and I’m finding my desire to condense and use other ways to express things, or use descriptions that can convey more, to be a preference.

I’m relishing in other forms of communication and leaning into more of the breadth of vibrational resonance we have access to experience and share.

And since we only see snippets of each other’s lives through platforms like this – the words I share here don’t speak to the rest of my time each day, which is balanced with a different layer of experience.

The extra quiet times in nature and overall shifts I continually align with are assisting a really sumptuous space of being.

This may or may not be the experience of others, but I share it in case it speaks to something stirring or emerging within you – something we may be sharing, amongst many other possible realities.

We are strings from a shared instrument and yet creating music is an innovative force in motion of individual and shared plucks to those tonal strings in a rhythmic sequence of alchemical genius.

Presence, peace, and neutrality cultivate the field of pure potential where true choices and answers can bloom.

In the loud, silent spaces I learn even more how to duplicate the way of the elements all around me and the wisdom of trees in a forest of diversity.

How often do we stop and listen to the vibrations emanating from everything around us? Not simply the words and individually-interpreted meanings, but the actual resonance and reverberations that feed us the ingredients we can consciously respond to and cocreate with?

This is the in between space I linger in and stretch myself to understand new ways to implement, integrate, and optimize for living in what feels, for me, to be as expansive and unified a potential as I can go in each moment.

That’s not everyone’s way, path, or choosing, but it’s mine – the way of reality-creation through shifts of awareness.

Amidst all of the new mental alchemy I’m brewing up, we’ve been externally engaged in continued, full Summer days of activities, immersions, and connection.

From a long weekend along the Northern Californian coast with friends – finding our own

piece of peace amidst city vibes and indulging in a cornucopia of vegan culinary feasts, to a

holiday weekend of celebrations with friends and community (including a vegan potluck that Dave and I made BBQ tofu with coleslaw and pickles sliders we cut in fours, and kayaking down the river), all linked by another

incredibly nourishing backpacking adventure – we continue to create our new life experiences post fur babies journeying to the stars.

Our backpacking trip was especially memorable, as well as impactful. This time we chose a favorite destination – bearing an equally favorite name – Star Lake.

This was our fourth time at the lake, but first time camping at it, which we did for two nights.

We desired to create a peaceful and relaxing space during the holiday rush, away from everything, but immersed in the ALL.

It was absolutely divine in every way, camping out on a quartz mountain, with raw quartz surrounding the lake and our campground, hiking through and exploring quartz fields just outside of the lake, and journeying across trails with incredible, expansive, blossom and giant juniper filled vistas along every step.

It’s hard to explain the immensity and awe of the quartz fields, and photos don’t do justice – so I didn’t bother to take any. It’s truly an in-person experience and boy did we feel the energy sleeping here for two nights.

I definitely feel like we received an activation and upgrade.

This time we had our new hammock, which was icing on the cake.

We spent long hours just being.

And even discovered right next to our campsite was a meditation spiral that someone had created with rocks and quartz.

I thought that was a beautiful nudge, as before I made the sacred circle in our yard, I actually had it in a spiral. But I didn’t have enough to make it a full spiral – it was just a partial one, so I opted for a circle. Perhaps this was reflective of my intention still manifesting for us where we would end up camping, or reflects a spiral may yet still come to be, if not a full labyrinth, as I feel I may have enough stones soon for a spiral. We’ll see!

Including a day hike and an extra rock hounding hike I did myself, plus the in and back miles, it totaled only between nineteen to twenty miles over the three days for me and seventeen for Dave.

But mostly there were hours of nothingness within the everythingness.

Bliss in every way and we were grateful to have created a full day, night and morning without another human around before a half dozen campsites popped up on our last night of the 4th of July.

I returned with gifts from the mountain spirits (some of which you can see in front of the tent below, being highlighted by some incredible energy rays and solar emanations) that I carried out the six and a half miles – turning my 22.7 pound pack (of which we ate all the food I was carrying) into 45 pounds.

We were both astonished, but I was invigorated by the energy that fueled my endurance, and although the hike itself was quite a strenuous accomplishment, I miraculously didn’t end up having any soreness after.

I chalked that up to the power and magick of the quartz.

We feel to do a backpacking and camping trip probably once a week through Summer and Autumn, as long as we’re around and not traveling.

I’m not going to share all of the details, but rather am sharing the vibrational frequency through photo stories in sequence of how they’ve been written by the ALL with us more consciously engaging our parts in a beautiful co-story I’m learning more of the laws to harness.

I can feel the vibrational resonance each time I create in this way and tap into the storyline fun I’m helping to make harmonious for the ALL’s experience.

As this is how I see it…we’ve always had invitation to enjoy and up our creative expression, as main characters within the One Mind.

I’m in awe of what keeps showing up and how much our intentions continue to manifest at even more fine-tuned levels.

It’s incredible, but not surprising, to see what is possible for us all to experience with greater mindfulness and tuning into what is really available in this blip in space and time we call our lives.

During all of this, what I’ve noticed is owl and hawk energy on all-time high in my world – with sightings, visitations, the most in number and most consistent influx of feather gifts from each, and even timed with their flying above or hooting from nearby.

Messengers are chiming in and being guide posts, the more I focus on upleveling my awareness and implementing changes.

Interestingly, the night before our backpacking trip on July 2nd, I had a powerful bear dream again.

It came on the heels of talking about Astrid and her transformational experience with a friend, which included starting off assertive, protective of herself and her boundaries, and charging with energetic force and grunts – very boldly at everyone. Then, how my unconditional love and “seeing” her allowed her to surrender into the softness beneath and shine her wisdom she kept hidden. She could turn on her “bear” when she wanted, but was at ease not to always be in that mode anymore. And in fact, one of the animals she looked like (minus her long, beautiful ears) was a young bear.

And of course, she WAS connected with bears and Arcturian energy as they are reflective of, and sent me the golden bear to my door, as well as many dreams.

But this particular dream – which felt real, like I was awake on a different plane – involved two young bears that somehow got into the house. They seemed to be yearlings and I heard them get in and come down the hall toward our bedroom. Dave was asleep and didn’t notice, nor did he wake up through it all. I was awake and heard and felt everything. The two bears then proceeded to climb up onto the bed and were particularly interested in me. I could hear their bear grunts and sniffing, and felt their fur and large bodies maneuvering on the bed around me. One kind of nestled to my right sort of between Dave and I – I felt that one connecting with both of us, but there for Dave more. The other was climbing on top of me and I was trying my hardest not to move because while they weren’t hurting me, I had that human feeling of any moment they could do something since they are wild. They did not have any ferocious or attack energy, but were clearly very set on connecting – this one in particular with me who kept playing with my foot and leg, which was up in the air now because she or he was keen on sniffing, licking and tousling it. I eventually, and slowly lowered my leg and got it back under the covers. The bear persisted coming closer and was going at my face now to lick it and sniff it. I could feel the heavy breathing and power of this young bear, although there was playfulness and a sincere desire to connect and show affection. I eventually pulled fast at the covers to hide my face, but this bear kept trying to yank the covers off with paws and teeth. I felt that they were both talking to me telepathically at one point, but I can’t remember what they said.

I don’t recall anymore except feeling they followed me when I eventually tried to get out of bed in the dark. It dawned on me when I awoke that Astrid was connected to sending them. Her strong assertive energy, with softness and love beneath, was reflected in these bears. I was reminded how she charged my face on the first day I took her home, but how I loved her more and saw into her heart.

It’s actually because of this dream that I was guided to wear this gold bear necklace with real leaves and flowers embedded inside that a sweet friend gave me. I feel it helped align a beautiful adventure and helped guide me to some incredible crystal finds – the likes of some I haven’t ever found before.

Astrid is in constant communication and I’m so grateful for these vivid reality experiences that take place because of the strength of our love that makes everything possible. And more recently Boojum showed up in a brief half-state between dream and awake, in a very real experience for me to impart to Dave that he was with us too.

Then on the morning of July 7th, my new little wild baby bunny friend appeared by our room, nibbling on fresh pine needles of our tree. It’s beautiful to know this sweetie is now going to grace our lives and this realm. I haven’t seen anyone else since this baby showed up. I still await a name, but feel it close. This appearance was a beautiful gift letting me know how love is all around me and the softness in my own heart is mirrored always.

Days outdoors are filled with sweetness, as all the baby animals are out and about learning the ways of the great big world before them, with mom and dad guiding and protecting the journey.

From bunnies, to ducklings, to goslings, to chicks (of all bird types), to hatchlings (lizard), to tadpoles, and more…we’ve been surrounded by new life in all the phases of childhood. New potentials are in motion for a New Earth experience.

It’s been fun to see some familiars too. In particular, the family of thirteen geese are still going strong and the goslings are now so large, but still hanging with their mom and dad and still have sweet fuzz on their lovely heads. They visit us on the beach each time we go.

Everything is prolific and lush right now.

In fact, my garden is more like a jungle and is larger in growth than I’ve ever seen it, while its roots flourish and unite in nourishing ways with the forest and Earth.

The plants are reaching tall for the Sun, Moon and Stars and that feels like a beautiful reflection, as I stretch into adventurous new territories of thought, practice, and experience.

May we all retrieve pieces of our courage to forge small steps forward into new fields of potential.

It only takes one stretch to fuel creative power toward new realities. From there, it gets easier and easier.
